summary: The Tax-Free Pell Grant Act aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It seeks to expand the exclusion of Pell Grants from gross income and adjust related tax credits. Specifically, it allows Pell Grants to be excluded from gross income and modifies rules around American Opportunity and Lifetime Learning Credits. Further, it broadens the scope of eligible expenses for these credits to include computer equipment, child and dependent care expenses, and course materials. The amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2024.
